author: The Associated Press
description: More than three years after a family of four from India froze to death while trying to enter the U.S. along a remote stretch of the Canadian border in a blizzard, the convicted ringleader of an international human smuggling plot was sentenced  to 10 years in prison.
title: Head of human smuggling plot gets 10 years after family of 4 froze to death on U.S.-Canada border

author: The Associated Press
description: A former Georgia police officer who shot and killed an unarmed, naked man pleaded guilty Wednesday to a charge of aggravated assault and won't serve any additional time behind bars.
title: Ex-Georgia officer who fatally shot naked man pleads guilty to aggravated assault

author: Tyler Kingkade
description: Trump pledged to redirect $3 billion from Harvard University to trade schools in a seeming bid for working class support.
title: Trump's latest salvo against Harvard: Pitting the Ivy League against the working class

author: Henry J. Gomez
description: The Trump administration has emerged as a staunch defender of Alternative for Germany, known as AfD, a party with Nazi echoes that has risen in popularity.
title: Trump administration emerges as a staunch defender of Germany's far-right AfD

author: Daniel Arkin
description: This is a free article for Diddy on Trial newsletter subscribers.
title: Diddy trial judge denies defense team’s mistrial motion

author: The Politics Desk
description: Elon Musk took some of the wind out of the sails of the “big, beautiful bill” as it moves to the Senate next week after passing the House by the narrowest of margins.
title: Elon Musk emboldens GOP critics of Trump’s big bill: From the Politics Desk

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Reality TV stars Todd and Julie Chrisley were preparing for their release from prison Wednesday after President Donald Trump said he planned to pardon them.
title: Todd and Julie Chrisley's pardons came after intervention by their daughter

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s decision to revoke the Covid vaccine recommendation for pregnant women has raised alarm from OB-GYNs.
title: FDA chief says pregnant women should decide on Covid vaccine with doctors

author: The Associated Press
description: Baylor defensive lineman Alex Foster died early Wednesday in Greenville, Mississippi, the school announced.
title: Baylor defensive lineman Alex Foster dies at 18

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: A Mexican girl is at risk of losing access to the life-saving treatment she has been receiving in Los Angeles after her family's legal immigration status was abruptly revoked.
title: 4-year-old girl's life-saving treatment at risk after family's legal immigration status is revoked

author: David Noriega
description: An immigration judge in San Diego dismissed the asylum claim of a gay makeup artist from Venezuela — one of at least 14 such dismissals to take place in recent weeks.
title: Immigration courts are dismissing cases of those sent to El Salvador, potentially cutting off their return

author: Alexandra Marquez
description: Constituents in Iowa's Second District on Wednesday met GOP Rep.
title: GOP Rep. Ashley Hinson met with boos at Iowa town hall

author: Gabrielle Fonrouge, CNBC
description: E.l.f. Beauty announced on Wednesday plans to acquire Hailey Bieber’s beauty brand Rhode in a deal worth up to $1 billion as the cosmetics company looks to expand further into skincare.
title: E.l.f. Beauty to acquire Hailey Bieber skincare brand Rhode in up to $1 billion deal

author: Joe Murphy
description: About 1 in 6 U.S. adults — 17% — have ever invested or used cryptocurrency, a number that has held steady since 2021, according to Pew Research surveys.
title: JD Vance says crypto can help everyday Americans. Here's how many actually use it.

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Former Arkansas police chief Grant Hardin was serving a decades-long sentence for a brutal rape and murder when he escaped from a Calico Rock prison.
title: 'Devil in the Ozarks': Who is Grant Hardin, the ex-police chief and killer on the run after prison escape?

author: Andrew Greif
description: Can New York or Minnesota rally? How impressive are Indiana and Oklahoma City? NBC News breaks down the NBA playoffs.
title: Knicks and Timberwolves are fighting for their playoff lives

author: The Associated Press
description: The WNBA says it cannot substantiate claims that racist fan behavior took place during a game between the Chicago Sky and Indiana Fever earlier this month.
title: WNBA says it cannot substantiate claims that racist remarks were made by fans at Sky-Fever game

author: Erik Ortiz
description: A Texas bill that would order the Ten Commandments to be displayed in public school classrooms was advanced by the Senate, sending the legislation to the governor.
title: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott plans to sign Ten Commandments bill after Senate approval

author: Jean Lee
description: Petrova also faces a federal smuggling charge for having frog embryos when she was stopped at Boston Logan International Airport on her way back from Paris.
title: Harvard scientist Kseniia Petrova is granted bail but remains in custody on a smuggling charge

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Kevin Costner was sued by a stunt performer Devyn LaBella, who claims she was put in an unscripted rape scene in "Horizon 2" without warning or proper filming safety protocols.
title: Kevin Costner sued by 'Horizon 2' stunt double for rape scene she says was 'unscripted' and 'violent'

author: Kevin Breuninger, CNBC
description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday pushed back against an emerging critique of his on-again, off-again tariff threats, which has been derisively summed up as the “TACO trade.”
title: Trump says he's not 'chickening out' on trade: 'It's called negotiation'

author: Marc Santia, NBC New York
description: A 37-year-old man known by some as the “crypto king of Kentucky” is on the docket for a court hearing in New York City Wednesday regarding charges he and a business partner kidnapped and tortured an Italian man, holding him captive inside a posh townhouse in Nolita for weeks in a bid to get the man’s Bitcoin password.
title: 'Crypto king' to appear in court for NYC kidnapping case

author: Mithil Aggarwal
description: Bed bugs have been biting humans since they emerged from caves around 60,000 years ago making them possibly the “first true urban pest,”  a new study found.
title: Humanity's 'first true urban pest' has been biting for 60,000 years, study shows

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that Hamas' Gaza chief Mohammed Sinwar, the brother of the group's deceased leader Yahya Sinwar, has been killed. Sinwar is the latest in a string of Hamas leaders killed by Israeli forces.
title: Israel says Hamas chief Mohammed Sinwar has been killed

author: Diana Olick, CNBC
description: Mortgage rates rose for the third straight week last week to the highest level since January, but some homebuyers were undeterred.
title: Mortgage rates rose to the highest level since January, but demand from homebuyers still grew. Here's why.

author: Reuters
description: MOSCOW, May 28 - Russia has proposed holding the next round of direct talks with Ukraine in Istanbul on June 2 with a view to achieving a sustainable peace settlement, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Wednesday.
title: Russia proposes to hold next talks with Ukraine in Istanbul on June 2

description: Al Roker looks back at the most devastating hurricanes to hit the U.S. since the turn of the century, starting with Hurricane Katrina.
title: Storms of the Century

description: President Trump said he would "take a look" at possibly pardoning the men accused of conspiring to kidnap Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer.
title: Trump says he will consider pardoning men who plotted to kidnap Gov. Whitmer

author: Greg Iacurci, CNBC
description: Spending from foreign visitors to the U.S. is poised to fall by $8.5 billion this year as negative perceptions tied to trade and immigration policy lead overseas tourists to look elsewhere, according to a research note published by Oxford Economics.
title: Fewer tourists are visiting the U.S. and the losses could be 'staggering, researchers say

author: Gabrielle Fonrouge, CNBC
description: Dick’s Sporting Goods said Wednesday it’s standing by its full-year guidance, which includes the expected impact from all tariffs currently in effect.
title: Dick's Sporting Goods stands by full-year guidance — even with tariffs looming

author: Dan Mangan, CNBC
description: The co-defendant in the bombshell lawsuit accusing former WWE boss Vince McMahon of sexual abuse and sex trafficking has agreed to cooperate with and give evidence to the woman suing the pro wrestling mogul and WWE.
title: Vince McMahon sex trafficking case co-defendant John Laurinaitis agrees to help accuser

author: Melissa Repko, CNBC
description: Macy’s cut its full-year profit guidance on Wednesday even as it beat Wall Street’s quarterly earnings expectations, as the retailer’s CEO said it will hike prices of certain items to offset tariffs.
title: Macy's CEO says retailer will hike some prices as tariffs cut into profits

author: Michael Wayland, CNBC
description: PLANO, Texas — Twenty-five years after introducing many Americans to hybrid vehicles with the Prius, Toyota Motor is targeting significant growth in plug-in hybrid electric vehicles, or PHEVs.
title: Hybrid leader Toyota targets major growth in plug-in vehicles amid industry's EV uncertainty

author: Gina Vivinetto
description: A Brazilian nun is earning raves around the world after she showed off her impressive beatboxing skills.
title: Brazilian nun goes viral for beatboxing on TV — and fans compare the moment to 'Sister Act'

author: Chrissy Callahan, TODAY
description: “Survivor” is preparing to celebrate a big anniversary with some major power players.
title: 'White Lotus' creator Mike White is among the star-studded 'Survivor 50' cast

author: Ida Siegal, NBC New York
description: A 20-year-old from Venezuela became the first reported New York City public school student to be detained by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents since the start of President Donald Trump’s second term.
title: NYC high school student detained by ICE after scheduled court appearance

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Chase Chrisley is breaking his silence on his parents' planned pardons.
title: Chase Chrisley breaks silence on his parents' pardons

author: The Associated Press
description: The governing board for California high school sports is changing its competition rules at this weekend’s state track-and-field championships to allow more girls to take part amid controversy over the participation of a trans student-athlete.
title: California opens track-and-field finals to more girls after success of trans athlete

author: Megan Lebowitz
description: Elon Musk broke with President Donald Trump on the House-passed domestic policy bill, saying he was "disappointed" that the legislation would increase the federal deficit.
title: Elon Musk says he's 'disappointed' with domestic policy bill in break with Trump

author: Henry Austin
description: Hamas Gaza chief Mohammed Sinwar, the younger brother of the group's deceased leader Yahya Sinwar, has been killed, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told lawmakers Wednesday.
title: Hamas' Gaza chief Mohammed Sinwar has been killed, Netanyahu says

author: Erik Ortiz
description: A federal judge has denied a legal attempt, for now, to prevent the U.S. government from transferring former death row inmates to the "Supermax" in Colorado.
title: Federal judge denies attempt to block commuted death row inmates' transfer to 'Supermax' prison

author: Matt Lavietes
description: A Delta flight erupted into chaos on Saturday when two pigeons were discovered in the plane's main cabin, video of the pandemonium shows.
title: Delta flight erupts into chaos as pigeons fly around main cabin

author: The Associated Press
description: UNCASVILLE, Conn. — Paige Bueckers returned to a familiar place to get the first win of her WNBA career.
title: Paige Bueckers gets first win as a pro in return to Connecticut

author: The Associated Press
description: Not many goods used in the wedding industry remain untouched by the tariffs Trump has imposed since returning to office.
title: Planning a wedding is stressful. Couples and vendors now have to factor in tariffs.

description: Elon Musk is criticizing President Donald Trump’s massive spending bill, saying it “increases the budget deficit, not decrease it, and undermines the work that the DOGE team is doing." NBC’s Peter Alexander reports for TODAY from the White House.
title: Elon Musk 'Disappointed' By Trump's Massive Spending Bill

author: Peter Guo
description: Researchers in Spain say they have found evidence that Neanderthals were capable of creating art — challenging the idea that art began with the modern humans who succeeded them.
title: With just one touch of a finger, a Neanderthal may have made art

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: A handful of Trump’s recent pardons show a shift in Justice Department priorities.
title: Trump's pardons of public officials and break-in at Beanie Babies mogul's house: Morning Rundown

author: Greg Rosenstein
description: Shohei Ohtani is already known as one of the most feared players in baseball.
title: Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani takes significant step toward pitching again

author: Astha Rajvanshi
description: Ex-Russian president Dmitry Medvedev raised the specter of World War III as the rhetoric between the White House and the Kremlin ramped up over the Ukraine war.
title: Former Russian president raises specter of World War III as rhetoric ramps up over Ukraine

author: Julia Ainsley
description: The Trump administration has dramatically stepped up its pace of deportations, according to Immigration and Customs Enforcement data obtained by NBC News.
title: Trump administration has ramped up deportations but is still far below pace it wants

author: Ryan J. Reilly
description: WASHINGTON — The government's evidence against Scott Jenkins was compelling, including undercover video and other corroboration showing Jenkins, then the sheriff of Culpeper County, Virginia, accepting over $75,000 in exchange for giving law enforcement authority to local businessmen, as well as two undercover FBI special agents.
title: Trump's pardons highlight Justice Department's pullback from public corruption cases

author: The Associated Press
description: A U.S.-backed group approved by Israel to take over aid distribution in Gaza says it has started operations, despite opposition from the U.N.
title: How Gaza's new U.S.-backed aid system works and what it means for the people there

author: The Associated Press
description: France’s lower house of parliament adopted a bill Tuesday to allow adults with incurable illness to take lethal medication, as public demands grow across Europe for legal end-of-life options.
title: France's National Assembly adopts long-debated bill legalizing end-of-life options

author: Astha Rajvanshi
description: Joël Le Scouarnec, the former surgeon at the center of France’s largest-ever child sexual abuse case, was handed a maximum sentence of 20 years in prison Wednesday as his three-month-long trial reached its end.
title: Former surgeon sentenced to 20 years in prison as France's largest child sexual abuse trial ends

author: The Associated Press
description: Six people remained missing Wednesday after an explosion at a chemical plant in eastern China shook nearby buildings, killing at least five people and injuring 19.
title: 5 dead and 6 missing after explosion at Chinese chemical plant

description: Pascal Siakam added 30 points in a game that was played in Indiana's uptempo style most of the night.
title: Tyrese Haliburton's triple-double sparks Pacers, Indiana runs past New York to 3-1 series lead

author: Adrienne Broaddus
description: A group of New York teenagers returning home from junior prom are being hailed as heroes for helping to get a father and his two daughters to safety upon noticing the family's garage was on fire.
title: High schoolers returning from prom hailed as heroes for helping save family from fire

author: The Associated Press
description: Tyrese Haliburton had 32 points, 15 assists and 12 rebounds without a turnover in a sensational postseason performance to lead the Indiana Pacers past the New York Knicks 130-121 on Tuesday night for a 3-1 lead in the Eastern Conference finals.
title: Haliburton scores 32 points as Pacers beat Knicks for 3-1 Eastern Conference finals lead

author: Dennis Romero
description: As the mission to capture all 10 New Orleans jail escapees inches closer to completion, court documents and dramatic video of a vehicle chase reveal some of their tracks, authorities said.
title: New Orleans fugitive allegedly told sister to wait for him outside lockup on night of jailbreak

author: Raquel Coronell Uribe
description: Rep. Mike Flood, R-Neb., faced intense questioning from people at a town hall Tuesday, at one point conceding that he did not read a provision in the House’s “Big Beautiful Bill” before he voted for it, triggering loud protests from the audience.
title: Republican Rep. Mike Flood grilled during town hall

description: Capricorn Clark, a former aid to Sean "Diddy" Combs took the stand in the rapper's trial. Clark testified that Combs wanted to kill rapper Kid Cudi over his relationship with Cassie. NBC News' Chloe Melas has the latest on the case.
title: Ex-assistant says Combs wanted to kill Kid Cudi over Cassie relationship

description: Hall of Fame QB believes Steelers failed Kenny Pickett.
title: Terry Bradshaw calls Steelers potentially signing Aaron Rodgers "a joke"

description: President Trump has issued pardons for reality TV couple Todd and Julie Chrisley, best known for their show "Chrisley Knows Best," after they were convicted in a scheme to defraud banks out of millions of dollars, their attorney confirmed.
title: Trump pardons reality show couple Todd and Julie Chrisley
